meanings.definition: Acting as an intermediary or connecting link.
meanings.sent1: The internuncial role of the bridge helped connect the two towns.
meanings.sent2: The internuncial relationship between the two departments facilitated smooth communication.
meanings.sent3: The internuncial squirrel carried messages between the forest animals.
meanings.sent4: Her internuncial presence at the meeting bridged the gap between the two conflicting parties.
meanings.sent5: The internuncial key unlocked the door to new opportunities.

meanings.definition: Relating to communication or transmission between nerve cells.
meanings.sent1: The internuncial signals between the nerve cells ensured proper communication.
meanings.sent2: The internuncial pathways in the brain allow for efficient transmission of information.
meanings.sent3: The internuncial neuron was the messenger between the brain and the body.
meanings.sent4: Her internuncial role in the nervous system kept the messages flowing smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The internuncial connection between the neurons was crucial for coordination.

meanings.definition: Serving as a go-between or mediator.
meanings.sent1: The internuncial diplomat helped negotiate peace between the two countries.
meanings.sent2: The internuncial friend resolved the conflict between the siblings.
meanings.sent3: The internuncial cat settled the dispute between the two dogs.
meanings.sent4: Her internuncial role in the argument brought about a peaceful resolution.
meanings.sent5: The internuncial mediator bridged the gap between the opposing parties.
